children.value:
A set of ui utility functions and default displays for bridging between
a web browser and a uport user's mobile app
Skeleton for a modal popup, styled with css imported from './style.css'

Format a modal with a QR code and a custom message, as well as links to
the uport mobile app on the app store and play store

Html string for a modal notifying a user that a push notification has been
sent to their phone
Html string for a modal displaying a success message
Html string for a modal displaying a failure message
HTML string for a modal displaying a spinner
HTML string for a modal displaying a provider dialog
Given a length, returns a random string of that length
Decrypts a response from a promise. This is intended to be used to wrap the response from Chasqui or other transport

A general Chasqui Transport. Allows you to configure the transport with any uriHandler for the request,
 while the response will always be returned through Chasqui. Chasqui is a simple messaging server that
 allows responses to be relayed from a uport client to the original callee.
A polling function specifically for polling Chasqui.
A general polling function. Polls a given url and parse message according to given parsing functions, promise resolves on response or error.

A push notification transport for pushing requests to the uPort mobile client of a specific user
 for which you have been given a valid push token.

The same transport as above, but also display a self-dismissing modal notifying
the user that push notification has been sent to their device

A QR tranpsort which uses our provided QR modal to relay a request to a uPort client,
optionally compressing the provided message if a compress function is provided

A utility function for reducing the size of a QR code by uploading it to chasqui and
replacing the contents with the topic url.

An empty Verification JWT (i.e. with signature and sub/iss but blank claim) is ~250 characters
The absolute max that can fit in a scanable QR on the screen is ~1500 characters
Below 650 characters the QR modal fits perfectly in the browser on a 13" MBP, with some wiggle room

A QR Code and Chasqui Transport. The QR modal is configured for tranporting the request, while the
 response will be returned through Chasqui.
A mobile transport for handling and configuring requests which are sent from a mobile browser to a uport client, in this case the uPort mobile app.
A function to fetch a response from hash params appended to callback url, if available when function called.
A listener which calls given callback when a response becomes avaialble in the hash params (url fragment)
A promise which resolves once a response become available in the hash params (url fragment)
Parses response from full response url or hash param string
Add params as url fragment (hash params)
Add params as url query params
Returns params object of query params in given url
Returns request token (JWT) from a request URI
Given string, returns boolean if string is JWT
Remove both deeplink and universal link prefixes from a given message
Wrap a JWT in a request URI using the Universal Link scheme based at id.uport.me
Wrap a JWT in a request URI using the Deeplink scheme, using me.uport:
Wrap a JWT in a request URI according to the specified scheme

A set of ui utility functions and default displays for bridging between
a web browser and a uport user's mobile app

Given a string of data it returns a image URI which is a QR code. An image
URI can be displayed in a img html tag by setting the src attrbiute to the
the image URI.
data string, typically a uPort URI
Closes the default QR pop over
A default QR pop over display, which injects the neccessary html
data which is displayed in QR code
a function called when the cancel button is clicked
message to be displayed above the QR in the modal
Show a notification to the user that a push has been sent to their phone
The fallback handler if the user doesn't receive a push

Show a success screen to the user which automatically dismisses
after @param {Number} timeout milliseconds
Function to fire when the close button is pressed
Show a failure modal that gives users the option to repeat the failed action
The function that should fire to allow the user to retry
A utility function for rendering a modal with particular content
html string defining the inside of the modal
the handler to fire when the modal's x button is pressed
A user's push token containing an endpoint for sending notifications
A user's public key for encrypting messages pushed to them
Title text that appears in the QR modal
- true if detected as running on a mobile device
Generates a callbackUrl that can be used to create a request which will return its response to this application
- a url that can be used as the callbackUrl option when creating a request with uport-credentials
id that will be used when sending the request that will contain this callback url
- object containing the currently configured pushToken and publicEncKey
Provide a user's push token and public encryption key to enable the configuration of a push transport
A user's push token containing an endpoint for sending notifications
A user's public key for encrypting messages pushed to them
Listens for responses to requests made by calling
. Returns a promise that resolves once with the resopnse.
- resolves a response object with { payload, data } containing the jwt and extra optional data
id of the request that that we are listening for
Sends a message by automatically selecting an appropriate transport
id of the request that will be used to identify the response
additional application data that can be included as part of the response
url to send the response to
specifies callback type 'post' or 'redirect' for response
called when user closes the QR modal
Sends a message using URL transport.
id of the request that will be used to associate the response
optional parameters specific to url transport
additional application data that can be included as part of the response
url to send the response to
specifies callback type 'post' or 'redirect' for response
Sends a message using push transport.
id of the request that will be used to identify the response
Sends a message using a qr transport
id of the request that will be used to identify the response
optional parameters specific to qr transport
called when user closes the QR modal
Skeleton for a modal popup, styled with css imported from './style.css'

html string defining content of modal

Format a modal with a QR code and a custom message, as well as links to
the uport mobile app on the app store and play store
data uri defining the QR code to be displayed
message to be displayed above the QR code

sent to their phone

HTML string for a modal displaying a provider dialog

properties.ariaLabel: urihandlersendurihandler config message ⇒ codefunctioncode  codepromiseobject errorcode permalink

children.value:
A general Chasqui Transport. Allows you to configure the transport with any uriHandler for the request,
while the response will always be returned through Chasqui. Chasqui is a simple messaging server that
allows responses to be relayed from a uport client to the original callee.
- a function to close the QR modal
a function called with the requestURI once it is formatted for this transport
url of messaging server, defaults to Chasqui instance run by uPort
milisecond interval at which the messaging server will be polled for a response

properties.ariaLabel: pollurl pollinginterval cancelled ⇒ codepromiseobject errorcode permalink

children.value: A polling function specifically for polling Chasqui.
- a promise which resolves with obj/message or rejects with an error
ms interval at which the given url is polled
function which returns boolean, if returns true, polling stops

properties.ariaLabel: pollurl messageparse errorparse pollinginterval cancelled ⇒ codepromiseobject errorcode permalink

children.value: A general polling function. Polls a given url and parse message according to given parsing functions, promise resolves on response or error.
- a promise which resolves with obj/message or rejects with an error
function that parses response from get request, also determines if response is available to decide to continue polling or not
function that parses response from get request and determines if error was returned.
ms interval at which the given url is polled
function which returns boolean, if returns true, polling stops

properties.ariaLabel: sendtoken pubenckey pushserviceurl message opts ⇒ codefunctioncode  codepromiseobject errorcode permalink

children.value:
A push notification transport for pushing requests to the uPort mobile client of a specific user
for which you have been given a valid push token.
- a promise which resolves with successful push notification status or rejects with an error
a push notification token (get a pn token by requesting push permissions in a request)
the public encryption key of the receiver, encoded as a base64 string, found in a DID document
the url of the push service, by default it is PUTUTU at
specifies callback type 'post' or 'redirect' for response
specifies url which a uport client will return to control once the request is handled, depending on request type it may or may not be returned with the response as well.

The same transport as above, but also display a self-dismissing modal notifying
the user that push notification has been sent to their device

properties.ariaLabel: senddisplaytext message opts ⇒ codefunctioncode  codefunctioncode permalink

children.value:
A QR tranpsort which uses our provided QR modal to relay a request to a uPort client,
optionally compressing the provided message if a compress function is provided
- a function to close the QR modal
dialog used in qr modal display
cancel callback, called on modal close
a function to compress a JWT, returning a promise that resolves to a string

A utility function for reducing the size of a QR code by uploading it to chasqui and
replacing the contents with the topic url.

An empty Verification JWT (i.e. with signature and sub/iss but blank claim) is ~250 characters
The absolute max that can fit in a scanable QR on the screen is ~1500 characters
Below 650 characters the QR modal fits perfectly in the browser on a 13" MBP, with some wiggle room
- the chasqui url of the message, or the original message if less than threshold
the smallest size (in string length) to compress

properties.ariaLabel: chasquisendconfig message ⇒ codefunctioncode  codepromiseobject errorcode permalink

children.value:
A QR Code and Chasqui Transport. The QR modal is configured for tranporting the request, while the
response will be returned through Chasqui.
- a function to close the QR modal
url of messaging server, defaults to Chasqui instance run by uPort
milisecond interval at which the messaging server will be polled for a response
A mobile transport for handling and configuring requests which are sent from a mobile browser to a uport client, in this case the uPort mobile app.
a function called with the message/JWT to format into a URI
a function called with the requestURI once it is formatted for this transport, default opens URI
an id string for a request, used to identify response once returned
additional data specific to your application that you can later receive with the response
specifies callback type 'post' or 'redirect' for response
specifies url which a uport client will return to control once request is handled, depending on request type it may or may not be returned with the response as well.
A function to fetch a response from hash params appended to callback url, if available when function called.
- A response object if repsonse is available, otherwise null.
A listener which calls given callback when a response becomes avaialble in the hash params (url fragment)
a callback function called as cb(err, res) when a response becomes available
A promise which resolves once a response become available in the hash params (url fragment)
- a promise which resolves with a response object or rejects with an error.
Parses response from full response url or hash param string
- a response object of the form {id: ..., payload: ..., data: ...}
Add params as url fragment (hash params)
- a url with valid params added as url fragment (hash params)
params object of valid params to add as url fragment
Add params as url query params
- a url with valid params added as url query framents
params object of valid params to add as url query params
Returns params object of query params in given url
- object of param key and values
Returns request token (JWT) from a request URI
Given string, returns boolean if string is JWT
Remove both deeplink and universal link prefixes from a given message
Wrap a JWT in a request URI using the Universal Link scheme based at id.uport.me
- A valid request URI, including the given request token
A request message (JWT), or if given URI will just return
Wrap a JWT in a request URI using the Deeplink scheme, using me.uport:
The associated deeplink uri for the given message
Wrap a JWT in a request URI according to the specified scheme
The message to be uri encoded
The URI method of the above two, either 'universal' or 'deeplink'

frontmatter.announcement: Announcing support to migrate old uport identities to new ethereum mainnet identities, see our Release Notes https://developer.uport.me/releases for more details!
